State of Nebraska DEPARTMENT OF INSURANCE Summary of Insurance Business in Nebraska for the year 1933 r Wm Also Comparative Figures of Authorized Companies for the years 1930, 1931 and 1932 i-. . . •

To His Excellency, Governor Charles W. Bryan: We respectfully submit the summary of business of companies authorized to write insurance m this State for the year ending December 31, 1933. DEPARTMENT OF INSURANCE, LEE HERDMAN, Director.

NEBRASKA INSURANCE REPORT COMPANIES CHANGING NAME OR PLAN American Indemnity Life Insurance Co., Lincoln, Nebr., changed name to Guardian National Life Insurance Co., January 10, 1933. The Farmers National Co-operative Elevator Mutual Insurance Asso - ciation of Iowa changed its name to Farmers Elevator Mutual In - surance Association, January 23, 1934. The Fraternal Aid Union, Lawrence, Kansas, changed name to The* Standard Life Association on August 1, 1933. Gibraltar Life & Accident Insurance Company, Denver, Colorado, changed name to Colorado Life Company, Denver, Colorado, Febr. 28, 1934. Grand Lodge of the Ancient Order of United Workmen of the State of Nebraska, changed plan to a Co-operative Non-Profit Life Bene - fit Association February 5, 1934, and changed name to Pathfinder Life Insurance Company. Great Western Hail Insurance Company of Lincoln, Nebr., changed plan to Assessment Fire and name to Great Western Fire Insurance Company, June 1, 1933. Lincoln Hail Insurance Co., Lincoln, Nebr., changed name to Farmers Union Hail Insurance Company April 6, 1934. National Accident Insurance Co., Lincoln, Nebr., changed name to National Assurance Corporation, January 26, 1933. National Assurance Corporation, Lincoln, Nebraska, changed plan to Stock Life March 8, 1934. Nebidaka Insurance Co., Omaha, Nebr., changed name to Missouri Valley National Insurance Co., March 25, 1933. Nebraska Disability Association, Hastings, Nebraska, changed name to Paramount Insurance Corporation, and moved its offices to Omaha, Nebraska May 10, 1934. Pathfinder Life Insurance Co., Grand Island, Nebr., changed plan from, a co-operative non-profit life benefit association to a mutual legal reserve life, April 17, 1934. Retail Hardware Mutual Fire Insurance Company changed its name to Hardware Mutual Fire Insurance Company of Minnesota April 24, 1934. Woodmen Accident Company, Lincoln, Nebraska, changed plan to Mutual Legal Reserve June 1, 1934.
